bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, August 14, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, August 14, 1891
Mr Beverly Y. Payne, To the Department of State.
Wreck of the American Bark "Sea Gull" of Boston.
Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, August 14, 1891
Hon., William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to announce to the Department the wreck of the Americal Bark "Sea Gull" at the port of Addah on the GOld Coast, as per information from the Concular Agent at Elmina and enclosure.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant,
Beverly Y. Payne U.S. Vice Consul
Consulate of the United State at Elmina, July 23rd 1891.
Alexander Clark Esq., United States Minister Resident and Consul General Monrovia, Liberia.
Sir: I have the honor to report that the American Bark "Sea Gull," of Boston O. W. Junvims, Master, has wrecked at the port of Addah on the Gold Coast few days ago.
I am expecting the crew by the next SS. "Congo." I shall try my best to send them on.
I have the honor to be, Sir, your obedient servant,
G. E. Eminsang U.S. Cons Agent
